com.github.kvnxiao.kommandant.command

Class CommandContext

  • com.github.kvnxiao.kommandant.command.CommandContext

  • public class CommandContext

    A data class for containing the context of the command. It parses a string and splits it in two based on the first available space. The first string represents the alias, and the second string represents the arguments leftover.

    NOTE: This class was written in Java. And why, you might ask? As of Kotlin 1.10, there is still some performance overhead in splitting strings by a literal. As such, string splitting in Java is currently still more performant than in Kotlin.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandContext()
      Constructor which takes in a string to split in two. Splits based on the first available space character. If a space does not exist, the args string will be null. If the input string is null, both resultant args and aliases will be null.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAlias()
      Gets the alias for this CommandContext. Can be null.
      java.lang.String getArgs()
      Gets the args for this CommandContext. Can be null.
      boolean hasAlias()
      A CommandContext has an alias if the alias string is not null and not empty.
      boolean hasArgs()
      A CommandContext has args if the args string is not null. The args can be null if the input string that was split had no space character in it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandContext

        public CommandContext()

        Constructor which takes in a string to split in two. Splits based on the first available space character. If a space does not exist, the args string will be null. If the input string is null, both resultant args and aliases will be null.

    • Method Detail

      • getAlias

        public java.lang.String getAlias()

        Gets the alias for this CommandContext. Can be null.

        Returns:
        The (nullable) alias.

      • getArgs

        public java.lang.String getArgs()

        Gets the args for this CommandContext. Can be null.

        Returns:
        The (nullable) args.

      • hasAlias

        public boolean hasAlias()

        A CommandContext has an alias if the alias string is not null and not empty.

        Returns:
        Whether an alias exists.

      • hasArgs

        public boolean hasArgs()

        A CommandContext has args if the args string is not null. The args can be null if the input string that was split had no space character in it.

        Returns:
        Whether args exist.
